p: The essential oil of Piper cubeba L. [ 29] presented in vitro trypanocidal activity against T. cruzi at concentrations of 45.5 and 87.9 µg/mL, being serially diluted in DMSO and evaluated by the MTT colorimetric assay [ 15, 16]. Analysis of the essential oil of this species revealed that sabinene, eucalyptol, 4-terpineol, β-pinene and camphor were the main components and were considered responsible for the observed trypanocidal activity.
